results.title: The Journey. Part 1
results.brief_description: The Journey is a fourteen and a half hour film, shown in six parts. It is not a conventional narrative film and at times, it moves slowly, deliberately allowing silence, time to think about what we have heard. “The Journey” examines aspects of the global nuclear arms industry, and, while it gives us a great deal of information, it is the voices of families from many parts of the world that we hear, voicing their fears, their discoveries, their hopes and their anger about the silencing of their voices by the media and information systems that stand between us and the truth.

results.title: The Journey (K)
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Richard Mason and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Twelve year old Ada lives with her father on a windswept mountain plateau, looked after by Martha, the housekeeper, and Martha’s daughter Agnes. On his deathbed, Ada’s father tells her to journey south to seek her true inheritance. But Martha, who is a witch, is determined to get to the inheritance first. She orders Agnes to follow Ada, kill her and steal her map. Agnes is unable to kill her friend and the two are drawn together on a journey for buried treasure.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: The film may be appreciated both as a complex story with many levels of meaning or as a good suspense story. A group of people in a train are as diverse as life itself, each character has a symbol, each person minds his own business oblivious to the others. During the journey the people disappear.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: A quiet sensitive and beautifully photographed story of a man in middle age, who has reached a “still point” in life. Without the drive to attain the rare moments of happiness which life offers, he lapses into warm memories of a life creatively spent, inducing a sensual nostalgia which threatens to cripple him. His urban frustration takes him to an old people’s home where he gives piano lessons to the daughter of a friend. But alone, yearning for the richness and depth possible in personal relationships, his dreams become haunted by Johanna, a past love. The film can be described as a journey; not of physical life, but of the individual’s inner self moving towards a point of self-acceptance, despite life’s disappointments and increasing loss of faculties.

results.title: The Jolly swagman. [Parts 1 and 2]
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams and Pacific Films
results.brief_description: A summer’s day in Ten Town. Young Gary (Gary Grey) is feeling dejected and neglected by his friends and decides to go for a walk. He comes across a billabong in the bush and meets a swagman (Ken Goodlet). Suddenly he is transported back in time to the 1860’s. With his record player in hand and with the help of the song Waltzing Matilda, the swagman’s life is changed.

results.title: The Job for you
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Employment Service established shortly after World War II, aims at finding a job suitable for the person and a person suitable for the job. Each district office has an up to date list of vacancies in its own and in other areas. Finding specialists for professional employment, placing handicapped people in work and arranging employment for migrants are important aspects of the work, and play their part in building Australia’s future.

results.title: The Japanese garden
results.creator_credit: dentsu and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Atmospheric shots of misty valleys begin this stylised look at the natural beauties of the Japanese countryside and traditional gardens. Shows use of water and stone ornaments in formal gardens. Oriental music provides a complimentary background. No commentary.

results.title: The Jamestown story
results.creator_credit: Karl Schiffman, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates
results.brief_description: Focuses on Jamestown, a community with a history of strikes and labor troubles. Discusses an innovative program of labor management and co-operation that brought Jamestown back from the edge of economic disaster. Includes interviews with workers on the shop floor as well as managers.
